Moda kot poslovna priložnost
Kakšne priložnosti se ponujajo v svetu mode in kaj to pomeni za manjše in nove blagovne znamke.
03 Nov 2019, 09:26 by Alenka Kociper



Predavali so številni tuji in domači modni strokovnjaki in ustvarjalci. FOTOGRAFIJE: Mario Zupanov



Oblačila slovenskih modnih oblikovalcev je bilo mogoče tudi kupiti.



Sanja Grcić upa, da prva konferenca Sistem mode ni bila tudi zadnja.


Konec oktobra je v Ljubljani potekala prva slovenska javna konferenca o modi, ki so jo organizatorji, Center za kreativnost in društvo za oblikovanje SOTO, poimenovali Sistem mode. Gostil jo je Muzej za arhitekturo in oblikovanje, ki deluje v Gradu Fužine v Ljubljani in ki je ustvaril imenitno kuliso za ustvarjalni, modno obarvani vrvež.Modni zemljevidV okviru konference je nastal Modni zemljevid Ljubljane in Maribora, ki označuje trgovine in ateljeje slovenskih modnih oblikovalcev in oblikovalk v obeh mestih, ki ustvarjajo ročno izdelane, s tradicijo in novimi tehnologijami navdahnjene ter do okolja prijazne modne izdelke. Na voljo je v dveh oblikah: v tiskani različici ga lahko dobimo v Muzeju za arhitekturo in oblikovanje v Ljubljani ter v Projektni pisarni CzK v Mariboru, v digitalni pa je dostopen na spletni strani www.czk.si.Kot je povedala Mika Cimolini iz Centra za kreativnost, je temeljni namen konference, da se udeleženci pogovarjajo o modi kot poslovni priložnosti ter o tem, kaj se je v zadnjem času z modno industrijo zgodilo in kaj takšne priložnosti pomenijo za manjše in nove blagovne znamke.
Trajnostna moda


Oblačila slovenskih modnih oblikovalcev je bilo mogoče tudi kupiti.

Na konferenci, na kateri se je za predavateljsko mizo zvrstilo okoli 30 strokovnjakov s področja modne industrije in modnih medijev iz več kot desetih držav, tudi iz Slovenije, se je predstavilo več kot 20 slovenskih modnih ustvarjalcev oziroma njihovih znamk. Dogodek je privabil številne udeležence, ki se tako ali drugače ukvarjajo z modo ali se nad njo zgolj navdušujejo.Na druženjih med predavanji ter na večernih showroomih je bilo slišati, da je konferenca dala odgovore na številna vprašanja, s katerimi se ukvarja modna industrija v Sloveniji, ki ji je s propadom tekstilne industrije precej pošla ustvarjalna in poslovna sapa. Med drugim je pokazala, da je prihodnost mode predvsem v trajnostno naravnani in etično odgovorni modi kot odgovor na hitro modo, ki je v zadnjih letih tako rekoč preplavila svet, prav tako, kot se za trajnost zavzemamo na drugih področjih.
Prav je, da pomislimo tudi na kožo in jo ovijemo v nekaj zdravega.
Tina Princ, ki ustvarja pod blagovno znamko Things I Miss, pravi: »V času, ko veliko govorimo o zdravi prehrani, je prav, da pomislimo tudi na kožo in jo ovijemo v nekaj zdravega.« Kot so poudarili tudi drugi predavatelji, je trajnostna moda na eni strani poslovna priložnost, saj se tu odpira pomembna niša v vse bolj okoljsko ozaveščenem svetu, po drugi pa je tudi ekološka nujnost. Sicer pa se današnji modni ustvarjalci povsem zavedajo, da je modni oblikovalec v prvi vrsti podjetnik, ki mora imeti izdelan kakovosten poslovni načrt in mora znati ovrednotiti lastno delo.
Slovenci v svetu mode
Srečali smo nekaj izjemno uspešnih Slovencev, ki v tujini opravljajo poklice, ki jih pri nas v svetu mode še ne poznamo, na primer razvijalec digitalnih vsebin, umetniška urednica, stilist za modne revije, strateg za razvoj blagovnih znamk, raziskovalka trendov, modna agentka. Med drugim smo srečali Anžeja Dežana, ki trenutno deluje pri hiši Chanel v Parizu, Katjo Horvat, ki je prišla iz New Yorka, kjer deluje pri modni hiši Hood by Air, ter Angelo Lukanovich in Alenko Marsh, ki sta poslovno priložnost našli v Londonu.
30 modnih strokovnjakov iz več kot desetih držav je predavalo na konferenci.
Kot je povedala Sanja Grcić iz društva SOTO, se je odlično obiskana dvodnevna konferenca izkazala kot izvrstna priložnost za udeležence, ki so lahko vzpostavili osebne stike s strokovnjaki s področja modne industrije, pa tudi kot prostor za vzpostavljanje dialoga o novem sistemu mode, ki s seboj prinaša večjo zavest o vplivih modne industrije na okolje. »Organizatorji si glede na pozitivne odzive udeležencev želimo, da bi se konferenca uveljavila kot vsakoletni dogodek, ki bi modni svet v Sloveniji zagotovo dvignil na višjo raven.«

Fashion as a business opportunity
What opportunities are offered in the world of fashion and what it means for smaller and newer brands.
03 Nov 2019, 09:26 by Alenka Kociper



Lots of foreign and domestic fashion professionals and creators have lectured. PHOTOS: Mario Zupanov



Clothes of Slovenian fashion designers could also be bought.



Sanja Grcić hopes that the first conference System of Fashion was not the last.


At the end of October, the first Slovenian public fashion conference was held in Ljubljana. The organizers, the Center for Creativity and the SOTO Design Society, called the Fashion System. It was hosted by the Museum of Architecture and Design, which operates in the City of Fužine in Ljubljana, and created a magnificent backdrop for creative, fashion-tinged hustle and bustle. designers in both cities, creating handmade, tradition-inspired and new technology-inspired and eco-friendly fashion products. It is available in two formats: it can be obtained at the Museum of Architecture and Design in Ljubljana and at the CzK Design Office in Maribor, and in digital form at www.czk.si.As Mika Cimolini from the Center said for creativity, the core purpose of the conference is to have participants talk about fashion as a business opportunity and what has happened to the fashion industry lately and what such opportunities mean for smaller and new brands.
Sustainable fashion


Clothes of Slovenian fashion designers could also be bought.

More than 20 Slovenian fashion designers and their brands presented themselves at the conference, which brought together around 30 fashion industry and fashion media professionals from more than ten countries, including Slovenia. The event attracted many participants who are in one way or another engaged in fashion or are just excited about it. At the gatherings during lectures and evening showrooms, it was heard that the conference provided answers to many questions that the fashion industry in Slovenia deals with. , which, with the collapse of the textile industry, has gone a long way in creative and business breath. She has shown, among other things, that the future of fashion is primarily in sustainably and ethically responsible fashion in response to the fast fashion that has flooded the world in recent years, just as we are striving for sustainability in other areas.
It is right to think about the skin and wrap it in something healthy.
Tina Prince, who creates under the brand name Things I Miss, says, "At a time when we talk a lot about healthy eating, it's also important to think about skin and wrap it in something healthy." fashion, on the one hand, is a business opportunity, as it opens an important niche in an increasingly environmentally conscious world, and on the other, an ecological necessity. Otherwise, today's fashion makers are fully aware that a fashion designer is first and foremost an entrepreneur who must have a quality business plan and must be able to evaluate their own work.
Slovenians in the world of fashion
We met some extremely successful Slovenians who are pursuing professions abroad that we do not yet know in the world of fashion, such as a digital content developer, an art editor, a fashion stylist, a brand development strategist, a trendsetter, a fashion agent. Among other things, we met Ange Dejan, currently working at Chanel in Paris, Katja Horvat, who came from New York, where she works at Hood by Air, and Angelo Lukanovich and Alenko Marsh, who found a business opportunity in London.
30 fashion experts from more than ten countries gave a presentation at the conference.
Sanja Grcić from SOTO said that the well attended two-day conference proved to be an excellent opportunity for participants who were able to establish personal contacts with experts in the field of fashion industry, as well as a space for establishing a dialogue about a new fashion system with them. brings greater awareness of the environmental impact of the fashion industry. "In view of the positive reactions of the participants, the organizers want the conference to be established as an annual event, which would certainly raise the fashion world in Slovenia to a higher level."
